summary: Joyce Ann Larkin was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents indicate she was a staff member whose payroll records are documented from at least January 1977 through November 1978. Her name appears on multiple payroll certifications and certification reports, detailing her position, annual salary, and gross pay during various accounting periods. A Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board specifically concerns her HSCA staff payroll records, indicating the postponement of releasing her Social Security number due to privacy concerns. The documents suggest a consistent employment history with the HSCA during the period of its investigation.
significance: Joyce Ann Larkin's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, her presence on payroll records indicates she was a staff member involved in the operations of the HSCA during its investigation. The fact that her payroll records were subject to a Final Determination Notification by the Assassination Records Review Board suggests that her employment information was considered relevant to the historical record of the JFK assassination investigation.
